page.title: 04LARBERT/STENHOUSEMUIR
page.content: Larbert is a typical Scottish village with a long main street dotted with shops the length of it and houses spreading out on either side of it, while Stenhousemuir has a modern{ {shopping precinct}with the shops clustered together round a paved pedestrian courtyard decorated by two{ {cannons},to remind passers by of the famous Carron Iron Works. The precinct has a very good range of shops in it, and ample parking. The{library}at the precinct, is a modern building providing an excellent service for the public. The staff are extremely helpful, and charming with it. The local{newspaper}is the Falkirk Herald which has a reporter for the Stenhousemuir and Larbert area. It is produced by the extensive use of modern technology based on computers.
